bibl.title: T. Calphrunii Siculi Bucolicon Carmen ad Nemesianum Carthaginiensem
Corpus omnium veterum poetarum Latinarm secundum seriem temporum
Venatici et Bucolici Poetae Latini, Gratius, Nemesianus, Calpurnius, in Germania hactenus non editi, nunc Commentariis luculentis explanati

Poetae Latini Rei Venaticae Scriptores et Bucolici Antiqui, videlicet Gratii Falisci, atque M. Aurelii Olympii Nemesiani, Cynegeticon Halieuticon, et de Aucupio. Cum notis integris, Casp. Barthii, Jani Ulitii, Th. Johnson, Ed. Brucei. Accedunt M. Langii Dispunctio Notarum Jani Ulitii, et Caji Libellus de Canibus Britannicis. Itidem Bucolica M. Aurelii Olympii Nemesiani et Calpurnii, cum notis integris Roberti Titii, Hug. Martelli, Cap. Barthii, Jani Ulitii, et Commentario Diomedis Guidalotti et B. Ascensii. Quibus nunc primum accedunt Gerardi Kempheri observationes in tres priores Calpurnii Exclogas.

Novantiquae lectiones, tributae in epistolas centum, et quod excurrit: in quibus infinitis locis Silius, Censorinus, Hyginus, Macrobius, Fulgentius, plurimis Cicero, Seneca, Martialis, Plinius, Calpurnius, nonnullis Propertius, Ovidius, Lucanus, Varlerius Maximus, Statius, alii, supplentur, emendantur, illustrantur, notantur.

Flavii Aviani Fabulae ad MS. CD. Collatae. Accedunt Variae Lectiones in Ovidii Remedium Amoris Theoduli Eclogam et Catonis Disticha curante Jo. Ad. Nodell, qui notas criticas in scriptores aliquot veteres adjecit

Nomina virorum eruditione ac meritis excellentium, quos inter quarta academiae secularia summis in philosophia ornamentis ... augebit ordo philosophorum Rostochiensis indicantur ... Praemissae sunt Quaestiones Philologicae.

list.head: Other abbreviations used in this edition
Groups of manuscripts and/or editions
list.item: edd.: All editions not explicitly referenced elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
edd. fere omnes: Almost all editions
rell. codd. edd.: All other manuscripts and editions not mentioned elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
i2 sqq: editio Florentina (1590) and all editions published thereafter.
edd. ante Wernsd.: All editions published before Wernsdorf's edition, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry.
Wernsd. sqq: Wernsdorf's edition and all editions published thereafter, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
Vienn. sqq.: Vienn. and all editions published thereafter, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
edd. ante Burman: All editions published before Burman's edition, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
edd. ante Beck: All editions published before Beck's edition, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
Beck sqq.: Beck's edition and all editions published thereafter, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
edd. ante Glaeser: all editions published before Glaeser's edition, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
Glaeser sqq: Glaeser's edition and all editions published thereafter, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
edd. ante Burm.: All editions published before Burmann's edition, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
Burm. sqq.: Burmann's edition and all editions published thereafter, unless referenced specifically elsewhere in an entry in the apparatus.
Nonnulli apud Titium: some of the mss. cited by Tit.
One of the manuscripts cited by Tit.
Codd. Titii: more than one manuscript cited by Tit.
Nonnulli apud Kempfer
cod. Vindobon. (see 3.19)
All editions published before p.
All editions published after p.
h sqq. usque ad Glaeser = The edition known as "h" and all later editions up to Glaeser's
h sqq.: The edition known as "h" and all later editions.
u sqq. usque ad Glaeser = The edition known as "u" and all later editions up to Glaeser's
Ulit. sqq.: Ulit. and all editions published after it.
edd. ante p: All editions published before the edition known as p.
cod. Vinob.: Codex Vindobonensis 305, a member of V that Giarratano deems worthy of use only here and there.
edd. ante Baehr.: All editions published before Baehrens' 1881 edition
Baehr. sqq.: Baehrens' 1881 edition and all editions published after it

list.head: Other abbreviations
list.item: Oudendorp = Frans van Oudendorp , cited in Burman's Anthologia Veterum Latinorum Epigrammatum et Poëmatum
Victor Vigilius is a pseudonym used by Kaspar von Barth in his notes to suggest conjectures that he is not prepared to print in his text..
C. Schenkl is H. Schenkl's father, whose unpublished opinions H. Schenkl cites periodically.
G. Hartel's unpublished opinions appear in H. Schenkl's edition
Barth cites content from the third book of Fruterius' ()"Coniect. Verisim.", which is no longer extant.
D'Orville is Jacques-Philippe d'Orville (), whose notes are recorded in Burmann's edition

item.ref: Haupt says that he used Conrad Bursian's collation of a Neapolitan manuscript.

list.item: Probably Louis Carrion (a.k.a. Ludovicus Carrio), Emendationum et observationum libri duo. This book does not exist in digital form.
